Sentencas: The Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-& delta; (SFMO) perovskite has been considered as a promising candidate for the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode in hydrogen fuel, but exhibits poor performance when exposed to hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: In this study, the catalytic conversion of methane on a SFMO perovskite anode has been systematically investigated based on the distribution of relaxation times (DRT) method, density functional theory (DFT) calculations and temperature-programmed surface reaction (TPSR) measurement.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: A LSGM electrolyte-supported cell with the SFMO anode demonstrates a maximum power density of 0.63 W cm(-2) in wet hydrogen fuel at 800 & DEG;C, but it plummets to only 0.01 W cm(-2) when switched to wet methane fuel.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: DRT interpretation indicates that the cell performance in methane fuel is dominantly limited by these electrochemical processes within the intermediate frequency range of 1-30 Hz, which are mainly concerned with the methane catalytic conversion process in the SFMO anode.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: DFT analyses further reveal that methane cracking should be the key rate-limiting step for methane conversion on the SFMO perovskite anode.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: TPSR investigation suggests that the methane adsorption is also an ignorable rate-limiting step that affects the cell performance.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation

Sentencas: These findings in the current study are expected to provide a fundamental basis for designing efficient perovskite-based SOFC anodes toward methane fuel.
Titulo: Mechanistic insight into catalytic conversion of methane on a Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-δ perovskite anode: a combined EIS-DRT, DFT and TPSR investigation
